The night was slowly falling around them, and after a while, most of
the sky had turned dark, except for the countless stars and a
perpetual blue light transcending the vastness of the celestial veil.

Yggdrasil: By the Matrix of all Transformers! This thing is indeed
really powerful! I've never seen something like that!

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> Windlord::
> 
> "Then Let's go"said the male and follow him
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > Yggdrasil: Acknowledged. If I'm right, Windlord, we might have to
> > cross the entire continent and then a strait. We're gone for a long 
> time.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > > windlord:
> > > "Understood"said the male "Just look out and think what I've said 
> > > about Hydras"
> > > 
> > > 
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> wrote:
> > > > : : Rodimus Prime : :
> > > > 
> > > > Rodimus Prime: Understood Yggdrasil. Take Windlord with you.
> > > > 
> > > > 
> > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > Yggdrasil's sensors went mad for a moment, but he managed to 
> > > pinpoint
> > > > the phenomenon's origin. It was almost overwhelming. If that 
> space
> > > > bridge led to a warship, then the army in it would be 
> tremenously
> > > > numerous...
> > > > 
> > > > Yggdrasil: Rodimus! I get some huge data from a phenomenon far 
> from
> > > > here. I'll just debrief you on the Ark and I'll go investigate. 
> The
> > > > Ark is secure and is currently held in check by some neutral but
> > > > friendly bots. I'm leaving now,  but I don't know how long 
> it'll 
> > > take
> > > > for me to come back. Send someone if you can spare. Prime out.
> > > > 
> > > > The moving tree switched his ways and went straight for the 
> origins 
> > > of
> > > > the signal.
> > > >
